channel.description: Storage Optimization with Virtual Data Optimizer (VDO) VDO is a device driver layer that sits between the Linux kernel and the physical storage devices. conserve disk space, improve data throughput, and save on storage cost. VDO employs thin provisioning, de-duplication, and compression technologies to help realize the goals. How VDO Conserves Storage Stage 1 makes use of the thin provisioning technology to identify and eliminate empty (zero-byte) data blocks. (zero-block elimination) removes randomization of data blocks by moving in-use data blocks to contiguous locations on the storage device.
